description:
28-year old Hashiba Kyouya has hit a new low after losing his job at a shady game developer. He originally quit his steady office job to work in the creative industries that he admires, but it's proving to be a challenge even for a motivated go-getter like him. As he finds himself back at his parents house, between jobs, he can't help but wonder what would happen if he had a chance to redo his collegiate studies. Maybe things would turn out differently if he had gone to art school instead... and, shockingly enough, he might just get a chance to test that theory.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: The first episode aired with a runtime of ~51 minutes as opposed to the standard 24 minute long episode.
synonyms: ย้อนเวลา รีเมคชีวิต

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Software Development
tags.description: Centers around characters developing or programming a piece of technology, software, gaming, etc.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Filmmaking
tags.description: Centers around the art of filmmaking.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

node.description:
__Doujin circle:__ Utsura Uraraka (うつらうららか)

[Website](http://u-u.2-d.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eretto_) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/290340) | [Pixiv Fanbox](https://eretto.fanbox.cc/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/erettochannel)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kionachi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfiy-dr0s1O6LJRV6KHomLw)

Kio Nachi is a scenario writer, designer and novelist from Osaka Prefecture, Japan. He started his career after his graduation from university, working as a designer in Giga, but made his debut as writer in the game Pastel Kitchen. He is also the main writer of scenario for a visual novel already adapted in anime, Ao no Kanata no Four Rhythm.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kionachi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfiy-dr0s1O6LJRV6KHomLw)

Kio Nachi is a scenario writer, designer and novelist from Osaka Prefecture, Japan. He started his career after his graduation from university, working as a designer in Giga, but made his debut as writer in the game Pastel Kitchen. He is also the main writer of scenario for a visual novel already adapted in anime, Ao no Kanata no Four Rhythm.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4685307000)

Originating from Studio Giants, currently freelance.

Front Wing is a Japanese visual novel studio that products that specializes in the production of adult visual novels. To date, the company has released 22 different games, came with three popular well-English released games/anime of Makai Tenshi Jibril, Majo no Ochakai and Canary.

Poppin'Party is an all-girl band in the BanG Dream! franchise. The group consists of five members:
- [Aimi](https://anilist.co/staff/109519/Aimi-Terakawa) (as [Kasumi Toyama](https://anilist.co/character/120229/)) on rhythm guitar and vocals
- [Sae Otsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/120235/) (as [Tae Hanazono](https://anilist.co/character/120232/)) on lead guitar
- [Rimi Nishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/120234/Rimi-Nishimoto) (as [Rimi Ushigome](https://anilist.co/character/120231/)) on bass
- [Ayaka Ohashi](https://anilist.co/staff/110903/Ayaka-Ohashi) (as [Saaya Yamabuki](https://anilist.co/character/120233/)) on drums
- [Ayasa Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/118799/Ayasa-Itou) (as [Arisa Ichigaya](https://anilist.co/character/120230/)) on keyboard and tambourine

Poppin'Party first started out with Aimi, Rimi Nishimoto, and Ayasa Itou, before adding the other two members to become a full band. They debuted with the song "Yes! BanG_Dream!".

An all-male band in the ARGONAVIS project of the BanG Dream! franchise. It is composed of 5 members: [Masahiro Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/150456/Masahiro-Itou) as Ren Nanahoshi on vocals, [Daisuke Hyuga](https://anilist.co/staff/150444/Daisuke-Hyuga) as Yuuto Goryou on guitar, [Seiji Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/128082/Seiji-Maeda) as Wataru Matoba on bass, [Shouhei Hashimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/134241/Shouhei-Hashimoto) as Banri Shiroishi on drums, and [Shuuta Morishima](https://anilist.co/staff/106743/Shuuta-Morishima) Rio Kikyou on keyboard.

The band was announced shortly before the start of the BanG Dream! 5th☆LIVE. Due to an uproar of worried fans that the characters from Girls Band Party! will have to interact with male characters, Takaaki Kidani, Bushiroad's President, clarified that the male project will not mix and interact with the existing project.

On May 11, 2018, Daisuke, Shuuta, and Seiji  were the first three voice actors to be revealed as part of the project. They announced the joining of Masahiro during their Argonavis 0-2nd LIVE -The Beginning- which they held on September 15, 2018. The last member to join was Shouhei, announced during their Argonavis 0-BEYOND LIVE -The Beginning-.

The name Argonavis is a reference from a large ship named Argo Navis in old Greek mythology, which was a large constellation that no longer exists, as it has been divided into four seperate ones: Vela, Puppis, Carina, and Pyxis, which gathered together and become the ship's head, the Argo. According to Morishima, "Argonavis" is the keyword of the combination of all stars.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)
